facetValues.label: Ancient Mediterranean and Near Eastern Studies (Vancouver)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Waitlist is now available for this course. Please do not contact the instructor or the department about enrolling in this course if there are no seats available in the course or on the waitlist. Please continue to monitor registration online.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
​Prerequisites: FNEL 101, 102, 201, 202 in the same language. 
An advanced level study of hən̓q̓əmin̓əm̓, the traditional language of the Musqueam people. The location of the class is on the Musqueam Reserve at the Musqueam Community Center, 6735 Salish Drive, Vancouver, B.C. For further information, please contact the instructors directly:
jill.campbell@musqueam.bc.ca or Patricia.A.Shaw@ubc.ca

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This section is for undergraduate students only. Interested graduate students should consult https://fnel.arts.ubc.ca/undergraduate/courses/  for more information. If this section is full, please register in the waitlist section. Email cis.program@ubc.ca with any questions.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Students must register for all of LECTURE and INDEPENDENT STUDY to complete registration for the course. This independent study section is a placeholder: there is no meeting time and no room assigned.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This course is run SYNCHRONOUSLY, meaning students have to log on and participate at the posted days/times. However, it is possible to complete this course asynchronously, if needed, by arranging to do so with the instructor at the beginning of the term. 

If you meet the requirements for the course/waitlist but are not able to self-register, please fill out this 2024 Winter Session Registration Request for LFS Courses form. An LFS Academic Advisor will assess your eligibility for registration and you will be notified accordingly.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Before registering the course, please complete French Language Questionnaire to determine which course level to start: https://fhis.air.arts.ubc.ca/french-placement-questionnaire-tool/  

If you have experience of French Immersion, you are not allowed to stay in FREN 301.  

View full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/fren301/  

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

instances.text: FREN_V 311-101 - Introduction to Literature in French

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Critical reading of foundational literary texts in French from genres of prose fiction, non-fiction, poetry, and theatre. 
View full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/fren311/   

Language of instruction: French 

If you are a native French speaker, bilingual, completed French Immersion 12, or graduated from a Francophone school, we can manually register you. Please send your request here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

instances.text: FREN_V 331-101 - Arts, Cultures and Society: Middle Ages to the Revolution

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Exploration of early French culture and literature from the Middle Ages to the close of the Early Modern period and the French Revolution; the impact of society on the arts and vice versa. 
View full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/fren331/   

Language of instruction: French

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This hands-on class provides students with a complete overview of the fundamentals of French Grammar. Aligned with CEFR level B2 objectives.  
If you are a native French speaker, bilingual, completed French Immersion 12, or graduated from a Francophone school, we can manually register you. Please send your request here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/ 

View full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/fren352/  

Language of instruction: French

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This course provides the knowledge necessary for the advanced study of French and for the comparison between French and other languages known to students. Understand French language as a system, yet with linguistic variation in the French-speaking world.  
View full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/fren370/  

Language of instruction: French

Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
